comment: Dr K.Q. Is readily available for extra help especially if assignment is not understood. She gave extra credit test to help bring grades up. She is an easy grader. Would definitely take her again. Group project for this class is most applicable to life in the PR industry. Real take away results that will definitely help when searching for jobs.
Professor KQ is new to KSU and learning the department ruls, she did a great job.  I would take her again.  She was clear on what the assignments.

Dr. Kamasa-Quashie was very easy to talk to and willing to explain the assignment to students that didn't understand what was required.  Assignments was delivered clearly.  The class was interesting and informative.

Dr. Kamasa-Quashie was very easy to talk to and willing to explain the assignment to students that didn't understand what was required.  Assignments was delivered clearly.  The class was interesting and informative.  Nice lady!

Professor K-Q's lectures are not fun. They are boring and everything is taken directly out the book. She does take attendance so you have to show up. She gives a moderate amount of work. 4 one page papers, 1 long paper and a presentation over the long paper topic. The good thing is she is an easy grader. I suck at writing & I got 100 on everything.

Class is out of 480 points: 2 tests (100 each) & other written assignments.  Nothing in the class is conveyed clearly.  She gave us 90 pages of info to review for the test which focused on only 4 topics.   Written assignments are easy and she gives extra credit.  I got a D on the first test, but now I have an A in the class.

+Nice person. -Unclear on assignments. -Wastes class time. Assigns a research paper so we can learn to write one, but the required Research Methods class does that already. She would benefit from more structure to how she spends class time and assignment directions. Nice lady and means well, but just take your elective requirement elsewhere.

Very vague with all assignments, and tests are ridiculous. Most of the class failed in the low 20-50s. Power points are useless, and no ones knows whats going. At all costs avoid her. She is a sweet lady, but not the best teacher. Worst experience in a classroom at KSU in my four years.

Where do I start? I thought she was going to be so nice when we first started and I'm already annoyed. She's rude and snappy for no reason. We just took a test that I studied for but I'm sure I bombed bc the PPT's were jam packed with info and I was studying the wrong things. This is an elective for my major and she tries to make it hard, like WHY.
